headline.main: Former Idols of Rock Now Confront the Blues

docs.lead_paragraph: Some of them belonged to legendary groups of rock-and-roll, including the Drifters, the Coasters, the Shirelles and the Young Rascals. The others were among rock's leading solo performers. A list of the songs they made famous resembles one of those hit parades scrolling up the screen on late-night television: "Under the Boardwalk," "Charlie Brown," "Soul Man," "Sealed With a Kiss," "My Guy." Now these onetime idols have banded together to form a new group, one that might be called the Plaintiffs. And the song they are singing, in a Federal court in Atlanta, imparts as much heartbreak and bitterness as any golden oldie.
